. Situated on the river Mbomou and at a stones-throw  from the border with the neighbouring

, Bangassou has been repeatedly tangled up in rebellion fights, including as recently as 2013. 

It is however known for the wildlife in the surrounding area and for its market. The city is home to an estimated number of 31.000 people.
There is a small, public use airport, not much more than a landing strip, but without direct international connections to further destinations.
